meanings.definition: The quality or state of having sides.
meanings.sent1: The sidednesses of the cube make it easy to distinguish its top from its bottom.
meanings.sent2: The sidednesses of the rectangle help us understand its shape.
meanings.sent3: I never realized the importance of sidednesses until I tried to draw a circle with corners.
meanings.sent4: Her argument lacked sidednesses, leaving everyone confused about her position.
meanings.sent5: The sidednesses of the mountain range were breathtaking as the sun set behind them.

meanings.definition: The condition of being one-sided or biased.
meanings.sent1: The sidednesses of the debate became evident as one candidate consistently favored a particular viewpoint.
meanings.sent2: His sidednesses towards certain students affected his ability to be fair to all.
meanings.sent3: The sidednesses of the coin always seemed to land on heads, making him believe it was lucky.
meanings.sent4: Her sidednesses towards her favorite team made her unable to see the faults in their performance.
meanings.sent5: The sidednesses of the judge were clear when he always ruled in favor of the prosecution.
